profileAlternative.name: Diksha Vanvari
profileAlternative.headline: Software Engineer at Facebook
profileAlternative.summary:
I started my career at Intelliswift Software, a software solutions and services company headquartered in the Silicon Valley. Working in the Java architecture team as a backend developer, I got a chance to envision, design and develop several performance driven, scalable software solutions in an agile environment.

In Fall 2015, I quit my job to pursue Masters in Computer Science at Columbia University, New York with a focus on Software Systems. Building on the foundation laid at work, I took up courses like Cloud Computing and Big Data, Database System Implementation and Micro Service Apps and Architecture that aligned with my passion of building quality software systems.

In summer 2016, I interned with the Gmail, Drive and Docs backend team at Google, Mountain View. Here, I worked on an alert automation tool that aimed at reducing an on-call SRE's operational workload. Spending the summer with some very talented engineers, I observed and learnt how to productionize software at scale, be on a lookout for automation and instrumentation, and learn from outages and their postmortems.

Since Feb '17, I work as a Software Engineer at Facebook, MPK.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description:
Software Engineer on the Mobile Data Infra team (Feb '17 - Dec '17) - Worked as a backend engineer on Facebook’s mobile analytics engine that powers Feeds, Ads, Search, Instagram and Oculus. This engine provides tools to send analytics data from mobile devices, aggregate data in real time, and present this data on visualization tools or route it to various data stores used at Facebook.

Software Engineer on the Funnel Analytics Service Team (Jan '17 - Present) - I work as a product generalist on funnel analytics service - a service designed to streamline an...

positions.title: CA Fellow - Graduate Teaching Assistant
positions.companyName: Columbia University in the City of New York
positions.description:
Awarded a full tuition waiver for outstanding performance as a Graduate Teaching Assistant in Spring '16.
Course Assistant for two units of Big Data & Cloud Computing.

positions.title: Software Engineering Intern
positions.description:
Software (SiteReliability) Engineering Intern with the Gmail backend SRE team.

Project: Alert Automation System for Gmail Backend

positions.title: Programming Assistant
positions.description: Fixed bugs in and added functionality to Columbia Courseworks, the university's course management system based on Sakai, an open source learning management system.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description: Involved in architecture, design and development of varied enterprise systems.

positions.description:

-Worked towards building strategies that attracted over 600 members to the E-Cell of D.Y.Patil College of Engineering, Akurdi in one year....

educations.title: Columbia University in the City of New York

given.text: Diksha was part of the team that I led for 2 years. Her innovative ideas, capability to grasp new concepts, the willingness and capacity to implement software within deadlines along with her lighthearted and jovial nature made her one of the strongest resources in the team. She would prove to be a valuable asset for any organization. See less

Crawling and Semantic Categorization of Websites
